title: Understanding the Functions and Graph
text:
$$/lim(x$$ , 3**-, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$3$$ from the left.
$$/lim(x$$ , 3**+, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$3$$ from the right.
$$/lim(x$$ , $$3$$, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$3$$ from both sides.
Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$3$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x) as it approaches that x-value.
##figure2.gif##

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching as $$x$$ approaches 3? If it is $$\infty$$, write $$-\infty$$ or $$+\infty$$. If it does not exist, write 'DNE'.

title: Limit Value
text: $$/lim(x$$ , 3**-, f(x)) $$=$$ $$-\infty$$ $$/lim(x$$ , 3**+, f(x)) $$=$$ $$-\infty$$ $$/lim(x$$ , $$3$$, f(x)) $$=$$ $$-\infty$$. As $$x$$ approaches $$3$$, the values of f(x) continuously go down into the negatives.\n##figure3.gif##
